subject: Update the subnet allocation quota mechanism
commit_message:
Update the subnet allocation quota mechanism

At the recent Neutron mid-cycle, we discussed using the absolute
number of addresses for expressing IP allocation quota.  After
speaking with SMEs in IPv6 and user experience it seemed that this
would be a difficult way of handling these quotas.

First, with IPv6 the numbers are just too large for normal integer
fields.  Python seems to handle it gracefully but there are also
considerations for databases too.  Even an unsigned BIGINT in mysql is
not large enough.  I will argue that this proposal is simpler from an
implementation perspective and shares all code between IP versions.

Second, it would require some complexity around the user experience
for IPv6.  This new proposal provides a *more* common experience to
the user since the numbers will be low enough to understand in both
cases.  The only thing that the user will need to grok is the minimum
address unit for each version.  This should be spelled out clearly in
documentation.

DocImpact

subject: Fix modifying a role with same name using LDAP

Fix modifying a role with same name using LDAP

When the keystone server was configured to use the LDAP assignment

role with the same name existed already and it would of course find
the entry that is currently being modified.

The server is changed to check if the entry currently being modified
is the one with the same name and the operation is allowed if this is
the case.

subject: Fix disabling entities when enabled is ignored
commit_message:
Fix disabling entities when enabled is ignored

When LDAP is configured so that the `enabled` attribute was ignored
for an entity (user, group, role, project) and a client attempts to
disable the entity, it remains enabled, so a user might think that the
entity was disabled when it's not.

With this change, attempting to disable an entity where `enabled` is
ignored will return a 403 Forbidden error.

Since entities are always enabled when the `enabled` attribute is
ignored, there's no change to reject changes that attempt to enable
the entity.

Closes-Bug: #1241134

SecurityImpact
This is for security hardening.
